column5: Thanks Kristal!
MMMM prosciutto wrapped asparugus an the barbee - one of my faves. what's for desert?
Hmmm Protein!!!
Hey,cooking is my posts,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, Ok,,,,,,,      Kristal can have this one.      Looks awesome.
Did you splash some Heinz on that or use the no name stuff Wayne
She also made a dipping sauce from balsamic, red wine, brown sugar and garlic to dip the filet in !
El Dorado Silver Deluxe !
I must not have heard the phone ring for our invite for dinner   My Sunday supper looks not too bad too
very nice Joey - where'd you get the spit? I've been looking for one long enough for ours.
Thanks, got it at Home Depot.
I hear if you dip it in garlic butter it tastes like..  never mind I think that one has been done   looks good
Kristal! Were you afraid the asparagus was gunna escape? Poor lil' things....
She hog tied them good Roy... no getting away for them little suckers!
That looks incredible.  Gunna try that, maybe this week.

The "fillets" where just some cheap cuts of Sirloin grilling. 4 steaks... $10 total ! She wrapped them with bacon and lightly seasoned them.  Last week I bought 4 "true" steak cuts that cost me $50. They didn't hold a candle to tonights meal...

Don't go calling Sirloin 'cheap'!! It would make for a tastier steak than fillet since it has some more fat content. Just a bit of garlic salt and a touch of black pepper is all you need on a nice steak. Now you are making me hungry and it's bedtime!
AT $10 for 4 that size.. CHEAP ! LOL. I grew up in a butcher shop...
why, didn't they want you in the house
LMAO Good one Terry.

Uhmm... I don't see anywhere in this thread giving me my due, for introducing you to the wrapped aspargas!!!!!! I do believe I was the first to get you to eat the stuff... I guess my cheque is in the mail! Good lookin vitals there... next time put a cherry tomato or two on the tooth pics! HH

LOL Joe... yah I have to give you credit as I wouldn't touch those green things with a ten foot pole my entire life until I was starving at the BOQ waiting for Terry to cook a meal ! LOL  Kristal picked the meal with no input from what we wanted... just a coincidence...  ..and Terry... it was pretty much one and the same. I was 4 when Dad bought our store and I played with my little wooden train set on the meat room floor or played in the walk in cooler. Not much has changed...now it's a beer fridge. lol

I was in the same boat Wayne until Joe cooked them up for a group of us at Bernie's. My mouth is watering just thinking about them.....  I'm hoping they'll be on the menu in September Joe....*hint, hint*
